shorts.title: Senior Care Expert Peter Tomasi of Scranton Explains How to Know When It’s Time for Home Care for HelloNation
shorts.title_distilled: Senior Care Expert Peter Tomasi of Scranton Explains How to Know When It’s Time for Home Care for HelloNation.
shorts.description: SCRANTON, Pa., Jan. 26, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- How can families recognize the right moment to begin home care for an aging loved one? That question is thoughtfully explored in a HelloNation article featuring insights from Peter Tomasi, Senior Care Expert …

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: BREAKING: Pa. Health Department OKs Tenor Health acquisition application for 3 NEPA hospitals
shorts.description: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.
shorts.content: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.
shorts.content_distilled: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.

shorts.title: Tenor Health says NEPA hospital purchase deal remains under Pa. Department of Health review
shorts.title_distilled: Tenor Health says NEPA hospital purchase deal remains under Pa.
shorts.description: Tenor Health Foundation’s CEO said the company is ready to own and operate the Commonwealth Health Systems hospitals in NEPA, but that the transaction still awaits approval from the Pennsylvania Department of Health.
shorts.content: Tenor Health Foundation’s CEO said the company is ready to own and operate the Commonwealth Health Systems hospitals in NEPA, but that the transaction still awaits approval from the Pennsylvania Department of Health.
shorts.content_distilled: Tenor Health Foundation’s CEO said the company is ready to own and operate the Commonwealth Health Systems hospitals in NEPA, but that the transaction still awaits approval from the Pennsylvania Department of Health.

shorts.title: Blue Ridge donates to Greater Carbondale YMCA
shorts.title_distilled: Blue Ridge donates to Greater Carbondale YMCA.
shorts.description: For the past eight years, Blue Ridge Communications has partnered with various nonprofit organizations within its service area to support its annual Spread the Warmth community initiative. The campaign aims to provide much-needed children’s winter clothing, such as coats, hats, scarves and gloves, at no cost to families in need. This past year, Blue Ridge pledged to donate a winter coat when customers added or upgraded their internet service. Since 2018, this community impact initiative has continued to grow each year. From left: Mary Pantzar, Craig Panzano, Alice Cavalier and James Wiggins, all from the Greater Carbondale YMCA; Carbondale Mayor […]
shorts.content: For the past eight years, Blue Ridge Communications has partnered with various nonprofit organizations within its service area to support its annual Spread the Warmth community initiative. The campaign aims to provide much-needed children’s winter clothing, such as coats, hats, scarves and gloves, at no cost to families in need. This past year, Blue Ridge pledged to donate a winter coat when customers added or upgraded their internet service. Since 2018, this community impact initiative has continued to grow each year. From left: Mary Pantzar, Craig Panzano, Alice Cavalier and James Wiggins, all from the Greater Carbondale YMCA; Carbondale Mayor […]
shorts.content_distilled: For the past eight years, Blue Ridge Communications has partnered with various nonprofit organizations within its service area to support its annual Spread the Warmth community initiative.

shorts.title: BOYS BASKETBALL: Push toward Lackawanna League Division titles heats up in the cold of February
shorts.title_distilled: BOYS BASKETBALL: Push toward Lackawanna League Division titles heats up in the cold of February.
shorts.description: The calendar flipped to February, and that means the high school basketball season heads into its championship run. Time is running short for teams wishing to challenge the leaders and earn titles in the Lackawanna League. Several key games are coming up this week that should determine the winners. On Monday night, No. 4 Scranton Prep will visit No. 5 Valley View at 6:45 p.m. in a game that will help determine where each will finish in both the league and in the District 2 Class 4A playoff picture. Scranton Prep (13-4 overall, 8-1 division) is the defending Division I […]
shorts.content: The calendar flipped to February, and that means the high school basketball season heads into its championship run. Time is running short for teams wishing to challenge the leaders and earn titles in the Lackawanna League. Several key games are coming up this week that should determine the winners. On Monday night, No. 4 Scranton Prep will visit No. 5 Valley View at 6:45 p.m. in a game that will help determine where each will finish in both the league and in the District 2 Class 4A playoff picture. Scranton Prep (13-4 overall, 8-1 division) is the defending Division I […]

shorts.title: HS BASKETBALL: New No. 1 teams in boys, girls rankings
shorts.description: After more than two months of basketball, there is another change at the top of the high school boys and girls basketball polls. Upset wins by the second-ranked teams over last week’s No. 1 teams resulted in the Riverside boys and Scranton Prep girls returning to the No. 1 positions. Riverside (17-1) defeated Dunmore, 88-71, to reclaim its spot in the boys ranking after three weeks. Scranton Prep (12-5) beat North Pocono, 52-37, and is at No. 1 for the first time since the Week 1 poll. The teams that lost those matchups didn’t fall far in the polls. Dunmore […]

shorts.title: Robert H. Spitz Foundation donates to Scranton Counseling Center
shorts.description: Scranton Counseling Center recently received a $7,000 donation from the Robert H. Spitz Foundation to help defray the cost of training forensic department staff in the Triple P Parenting Program. Forensic caseworkers will use this training to work with low-income families to increase their parenting capacity by teaching appropriate parenting methods that will foster more positive home environments. From left: Cathy Fitzpatrick, director of grants and scholarships, Scranton Area Community Foundation; Doug Hein, director of development, Scranton Counseling Center; Chelsea Graziano, director of forensic services, Scranton Counseling Center; and Frank Caputo, grants and scholarships manager, Scranton Area Community Foundation.
shorts.content: Scranton Counseling Center recently received a $7,000 donation from the Robert H. Spitz Foundation to help defray the cost of training forensic department staff in the Triple P Parenting Program. Forensic caseworkers will use this training to work with low-income families to increase their parenting capacity by teaching appropriate parenting methods that will foster more positive home environments. From left: Cathy Fitzpatrick, director of grants and scholarships, Scranton Area Community Foundation; Doug Hein, director of development, Scranton Counseling Center; Chelsea Graziano, director of forensic services, Scranton Counseling Center; and Frank Caputo, grants and scholarships manager, Scranton Area Community Foundation.
